pt: {sc}expedient{/sc} {sc}politic{/sc} {sc}advisable{/sc} mean dictated by practical or prudent motives. {sc}expedient{/sc} usually implies what is immediately advantageous without regard for ethics or consistent principles.
{sc}politic{/sc} stresses judiciousness and tactical value but usually implies some lack of candor or sincerity.
{sc}advisable{/sc} applies to what is practical, prudent, or advantageous but lacks the derogatory implication of {sc}expedient{/sc} and {sc}politic{/sc}.

pt: {sc}resource{/sc} {sc}resort{/sc} {sc}expedient{/sc} {sc}shift{/sc} {sc}makeshift{/sc} {sc}stopgap{/sc} mean something one turns to in the absence of the usual means or source of supply. {sc}resource{/sc} and {sc}resort{/sc} apply to anything one falls back upon.
{sc}expedient{/sc} may apply to any device or contrivance used when the usual one is not at hand or not possible.
{sc}shift{/sc} implies a tentative or temporary imperfect expedient.
{sc}makeshift{/sc} implies an inferior expedient adopted because of urgent need or allowed through indifference.
{sc}stopgap{/sc} applies to something used temporarily as an emergency measure.

pt.t: a new law intended only as a {it}stopgap{/it}
